Helper function to generate precision matrix Q for simulation

Source: R/sim_dist_spde.R
dot-Q.Rd

.Q(
  mesh,
  barrier.triangles,
  range = 50,
  range_fraction = 0.2,
  sigma_u = 1,
  model = "spde"
)

Arguments

mesh

The mesh created by R-INLA representing the spatial area.

barrier.triangles

A list of mesh triangles that represent the barrier (used only for the barrier model).

range

The decorrelation range.

range_fraction

Fraction used to adjust the range across the "land" (barrier) regions. Only used in the barrier model.

sigma_u

The overall variance of the spatial process.

model

Either "spde" for the standard SPDE model or "barrier" for the barrier model.

Value

A sparse precision matrix Q of class dgTMatrix.

Details

Creates a precision matrix from a mesh created by R-INLA, given a specified decorrelation range. This function supports both the standard SPDE approach and the barrier model version. It serves a similar purpose to .sp_covar().
